channel.title: What the hell?
channel.description: Well, today I decided to run a test and check to see what the resolution on my 50" Plasma (1080p mind you, also inb4bragger) was, and I actually found out, the screen on my laptop (17.3 inch) has a higher resolution. My laptop has a 1920x1080, while my TV only has 1600x1024. Would this mean my laptop is 1080p as well? I say yes, buy my uncle and Mom both are trying to tell me no.

item.title: What the hell?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Mack n cheese, post:11, topic:389086”]they both probably really look the same, if you can’t tell.

so who cares? (:[/quote]
I can, just the idiot relatives were argueing over it lol.

Read full topic

they both probably really look the same, if you can’t tell.

item.title: What the hell?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

rip4d:

Well size is damn nice. TVs though have lower resolutions than computers though because computers have smaller things on them, such as text, that need the extra definition to read.

Yea, after hooking up minecraft, I really noticed the bad detail on the 50" rather than my laptop.

[quote=“Uncalled, post:6, topic:389086”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=484901.msg3553613#msg3553613 date=1301707461]

The laptop monitor is higher definition

I’ll just try to convince my uncle its a yes, my Mom is convinced after said, thats its better, just my Uncle is all about size.
[/quote]Tell him Java nerds know what we’re talking about ;)[/quote]
Oh god, they already know I have been programming for around 2 years, but that, I might get knocked the fuck out lol. (After my 11 hour work day, and 2 hours of tending to animals, it won’t take much)

Read full topic
